summary: Mary Susan Grimes was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is listed in payroll and certification reports from April 1978, August 1978, and December 1978. These documents provide details such as her name, social security number, annual salary, and gross pay for the specified periods. The documents indicate her employment with the committee during the period it was actively investigating the JFK assassination.
significance: Mary Susan Grimes' significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). As an employee, she was part of the team that investigated the JFK assassination, though the specific nature and impact of her role are not detailed in the provided documents. Her presence on the payroll and certification reports confirms her involvement with the committee during its active investigation period.
